details.description:
A hands-on course examining the business and marketing opportunities for open data, in collaboration with the Institute of Digital and Direct Marketers.

The course will cover

  • The difference between open, closed and personal data
  • The opportunities and benefits of open data for businesses and clients
  • How open data can improve ROI
  • Law, licensing and intellectual property, Finding, sourcing and using open data
  • How to assess the value of datasets
  • Best practices for publishing open data
  • Case studies and examples

By the end end of the course you will…

  • Have an overview of open data and driving trends
  • Understand where and how open data can be applied in marketing, its benefits and risks
  • Appreciate the breadth of skills and processes required to work with open data
  • Discover and begin to use open data
  • Understand the key decisions required to make open data work for you or your marketing team
  • Be confident in discussing open data and its benefits with others

Who is this for?

Client-side marketers, entrepreneurs, startups, policy makers, planners, strategists, account directors/managers.

Course prerequisites

No previous experience of data required, however good computer literacy is essential and comfort with using the web and spreadsheets an advantage.

Course requirements

A Wi-Fi enabled laptop, on which you have access to install software. iPads, tablets and mobile devices will not be suitable for hands-on sessions. Locked down corporate or public sector laptops may not be suitable to use for this course due to security limitations, please check with ODI before attending.
